text: hi everyone today I will share with you
a recipe for a variation of fur which is
unique to you lie a Highland city in
central Vietnam the official name is
called for a co li is proudly named for
that city
the dish is sometimes also called double
ball for or for a title because it's
serving two bowls one for the noodles
and one for the soup I start to make the
broth place the bones in a large pot
filled with enough water to cover as
some salt and vinegar to remove the best
meal you can use pot bones or beef bone
or chicken bones or mix of those bring
to a boil and then cook the bones for
about 5 to 10 minutes until the
impurities right to the top then drain
the pot and drinks the bones where under
running water place the bones back in a
large and clean stockpot and I feel with
water if you use the same part make sure
you clean it well before putting the
bones back it's a very crucial for a
clear broth add some brown sugar some
salt then add onion and skim the scum if
you want the broth to be extra fragrance
you can grill some shallots until charge
and then rings well under water to
remove all the black bits and add to the
pot bring the pot to a boil and reduce
the heat to low simmer and cover for
about 1 to 2 hours
occasionally scheme up the scum if the
broth reduces you can add hot water to
compensate making sure you always have
the same amount as when you started
to make the toppings in a medium bowl
you can season the ground pork with salt
and pepper add a splash of water to the
bowl and stir to separate the meat
chunks
you also need some minced garlic thinly
sliced shallots and some fatback or pot
lot which I will cut into small dices
then I will render the fat in a medium
pan over medium-high heat cook and stir
to render the fat for about five minutes
then remove them with a slotted spoon
and transfer the pot rice to a bowl
fry the sliced shallots until golden
brown and transfer to a bowl add the
ground pork to the remaining fat in the
pan and stir fry over medium heat until
is cooked roll us Batchelor to break up
any chunks and then we can turn off the
heat season the broth to taste with salt
and chicken stock powder to assemble the
furball firstly you want to blanch some
bean sprouts and the noodles in a Ludo
strainer
submerge into a pot of boiling water for
about 30 seconds to blanch and then
bring and toss with the fried garlic oil
a dash of soy sauce and a squeeze of
hoisin sauce then toss well until fully
coated
[Music]
polish bow using a ladle submerge a few
slices of raw beef into the simmering
broth to blanch for about five seconds
and then bring in place on top of the
noodles and also top with the ground pop
like a crock in season halfway through
the beef balls and then add them to the
broth to cook for about five minutes top
the bowl with the beef balls the fried
garlic shallots and pot rice you use a
separate Bowl to put the hot broth maybe
some bones too and then add some black
pepper and garnish with some chopped
scallion or a cilantro an aside you need
a platter of lettuce ice and bezos chili
pepper slices long watches and some
haunting and si Racha for dipping to
serve you just mix everything's up add
some Hertz and the sauce oh it's so good
if you're a friend of cry noodles this
dish is definitely for you I hope you
enjoyed today's recipe if you liked it
don't forget to click thumbs up and
